page.title: 01SUMMARY,CAUNTON STUDY AREA
page.content: The study area is mainly farmland. It contains many isolated farms,a hamlet(Norwell Woodhouse)and a village(Caunton).Most of the study group live in Caunton. Caunton is a very old village.It has a church and a post office/shop. There is a primary school/community centre.Caunton also has an old chapel which has been converted into a house and a disused windmill.There are two inns.In the centre of the village is a coalyard.Electricity is the only mains service provided.Many trade services visit the area. Many streams run through the area including The Beck in Caunton which runs over Ford Lane. Leisure activities include many clubs and organisations which cater for all age groups.
